results.title: Acting problems
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds, Wesley Greene and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Dr Maurice Griesen directs four actors from the Goodman Memorial Theatre in scenes from “Tom Sawyer”. He discusses the actor’s problem of achieving characterization and theatrical terms such as improvisation and rhythm tempo.

results.title: Wilder's 'The Long Christmas dinner'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Interviewed on the set of the film version of Thornton Wilder’s play ‘The long christmas dinner’, the principal players in this film are asked to compare the advantages and disadvantages of acting for film and for the stage. Although not all the actors interviewed agreed, most concur that acting for film presents a special challenge. Cast includes David Soul and Andrew Robinson.

results.title: An Act of faith
results.creator_credit: John Read, Robin Whitworth and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: The story of the new Cathedral at Coventry. Beginning with the blitz that destroyed the medieval church, it moves through all the stages of rebuilding and visits the studios of the artists concerned. Features Graham Sutherland’s gigantic tapestry, Epstein’s St. Michael and the devil, some of the stained glass windows, and the figures engraved on the plate glass entrance.

results.title: The Act of abortion
results.creator_credit: Terence O'Reilly, Shirley Fisher and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
An examination of the difficulties which surround women who want and those who perform the act of abortion. The 1967 Abortion Act in Britain is to be reviewed. This well intentioned legislation has resulted in illogicalities whereby some private abortionists are profitting while the National Health Service is sometimes reluctant to help.

results.title: Across the Strait
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
The Cape Barren goose one of the world’s rarest species, is found on the island in Bass Strait. Looks at the birds in their natural environment and describes their varying fortunes at the hands of man. Other birds filmed include Pacific gulls, cormorants, black swans, the chestnut teal and the spur-winged plover also emphasising research by Dr. Dorward on Glennie Island.
